Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town's Enigma and Impending Demolition
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the mysterious setting of Ghost Town, the initial temporal anomaly perceived by the woman in the green hat, and the subsequent revelation of the town's imminent destruction due to airport construction, setting up Nan's emotional connection and conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Immersion and Temporal Discrepancy
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene establishes the setting of Ghost Town and the woman in the green hat's initial reaction to the seemingly authentic historical atmosphere, contrasted with her internal thoughts about modern life.

narrative_arcs.title: Woman's Internal Thoughts on Time Discrepancy

sub_scenes.title: Warning and Foreshadowing of Danger
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a conversation hinting at danger within Ghost Town, as a man urges a woman to leave, foreshadowing potential conflicts or threats associated with the location.

sub_scenes.title: Nostalgic Memory and Current Reality of Ghost Town
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene delves into Nan's personal connection to Ghost Town through her memories, contrasting her romanticized past with the current clarification of its status as Merrick Gulch, bridging personal history with present changes.

narrative_arcs.title: Clarification of Ghost Town's Current State

sub_scenes.title: Revelation of Airport Construction and Nan's Outcry
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals the external threat to Ghost Town – the airport construction plans. It culminates in Nan's emotional reaction to this news, highlighting her deep emotional investment in the place and setting up a conflict between development and preservation.

narrative_arcs.title: Reaction to Airport Plan - Initial Shock and Disbelief

Major_Arcs.title: Relationship Dynamics and the Impending Demolition
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to Nan and Cal's relationship amidst the backdrop of Ghost Town's demolition. It explores their romantic discord, Nan's emotional vulnerabilities, and the physical start of the town's destruction, culminating in Nan's emotional distress and isolation.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Misunderstandings and Reflections
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene delves into the complexities of Nan and Cal's relationship, contrasting Nan's romantic ideals with Cal's practical nature, and revealing past emotional conflicts and hurts through their dialogue and Nan's internal reflections.

narrative_arcs.title: Cal's Perspective on Dreams and Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Transition to Demolition and Immediate Action
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene acts as a bridge, transitioning from the personal relationship drama to the external event of Ghost Town's demolition. It shows the shift from conversation to active destruction and immediate confrontation.

sub_scenes.title: Domestic Conflict and Emotional Humiliation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts to a domestic setting, highlighting business discussions related to the airport and escalating conflict between Nan and her father. It culminates in Nan's deep humiliation and feeling of betrayal, emphasizing her emotional isolation.

Major_Arcs.title: Reassurance, Resolve, and Business Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan's emotional recovery and shift from despair to determination. It includes reassurances from her mother and maid regarding her relationship with Cal, Nan's internal resolve for clarity, and her assertive engagement in business matters, showcasing her growing agency.

sub_scenes.title: Seeking Comfort and Relationship Advice
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Nan receiving comfort and relationship advice from her mother and maid, focusing on reassuring her about Cal's love and intentions, and offering different perspectives on relationships.

narrative_arcs.title: Confirmation of Cal's Affection and Effort

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Internal Resolve and Determination
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene highlights Nan's internal shift from despair to resolve. It showcases her determination to seek clarity in her relationship with Cal and confront him, marking her growing agency and proactive approach.

sub_scenes.title: Business Urgency and Assertive Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts the focus back to practical matters, showing Nan dealing with business urgency regarding horses and then assertively confronting a man (possibly her father) about a business deal, demonstrating her newfound assertiveness and engagement in practical affairs.

Major_Arcs.title: Ambiguous Affection, Departure, and Lingering Longing
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores the complex and somewhat ambiguous interaction between Nan and Cal, marked by Nan's emotional confession, Cal's cryptic response, his abrupt departure, and Nan's subsequent longing and pursuit, leaving their relationship status uncertain.

sub_scenes.title: Confession of Deep Feelings and Cryptic Rejection
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Nan's vulnerable confession of her deep feelings to Cal and his somewhat enigmatic and non-committal response, creating tension and uncertainty about his reciprocation.

narrative_arcs.title: Expression of Deep Feelings and Cryptic Response

sub_scenes.title: Abrupt Departure and Unresolved Emotions
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene highlights Cal's sudden departure, leaving Nan with unanswered questions and unresolved emotions, emphasizing his focus on duty over personal connection and creating a sense of separation.

narrative_arcs.title: Passage of Time and Lingering Longing
Confession of Pursuit and Revealed Motivation

Major_Arcs.title: Emotional Confession, Weather Crisis, and Cal's Resolve
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Nan's persistent emotional pursuit of Cal, her confrontation about his changed behavior, and the introduction of a severe weather crisis. It showcases Cal's shift from romantic ambiguity to decisive leadership in the face of the blizzard.

sub_scenes.title: Direct Confrontation about Changed Behavior
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Nan's direct and vulnerable confrontation with Cal about his changed demeanor and her longing for his past affection, highlighting her emotional investment and desire for reciprocation.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Confession about Changed Behavior

sub_scenes.title: Arrival of Weather Crisis and Widespread Concern
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the severe blizzard as a major plot element, showing the escalating concerns about weather conditions, livestock fodder, and the well-being of loved ones caught in the storm, shifting the focus from personal drama to a broader environmental crisis.

narrative_arcs.title: Indoor Discussion of Weather and Worry for Loved Ones

sub_scenes.title: Cal's Leadership and Decisive Action
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene showcases Cal's shift to leadership and decisive action in response to the blizzard. He demonstrates resolve and responsibility, contrasting with his earlier ambiguous romantic behavior, and highlighting his connection to his father's wisdom and ranching heritage.

narrative_arcs.title: Cal's Determined Resolve and Acceptance of Responsibility

Major_Arcs.title: Despair, Relief, and Renewed Hope amidst the Blizzard
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc portrays the emotional rollercoaster of the blizzard, moving from initial concerns and growing despair to a sudden and dramatic relief with the arrival of 'Operation Hay Lift'. It highlights the shift from hopelessness to gratitude and renewed optimism, and the rekindling of romance amidst adversity.

sub_scenes.title: Indoor Worry and Outdoor Reassurance Attempt
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene establishes the immediate worry and tension caused by the ongoing blizzard. It contrasts Nan's indoor anxiety with an outdoor attempt at reassurance, setting a tone of unease and anticipation.

narrative_arcs.title: Recollection of Restlessness and Expression of Hopelessness

sub_scenes.title: Arrival of Hope - Operation Hay Lift
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene marks a turning point with the unexpected arrival of a plane carrying fodder, drastically shifting the narrative from despair to hope. It introduces 'Operation Hay Lift' as a source of external aid and relief.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival of the Plane and Fodder Drop
Relief, Gratitude, and Renewed Hope with 'Operation Hay Lift'

Major_Arcs.title: Western Town Showdown and Contrasting Perspectives
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a new setting and characters, depicting a classic Western showdown and showcasing varied reactions to the cowboy's actions. It explores themes of heroism, immaturity, and contrasting perspectives on masculinity and conflict resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Public Showdown and Initial Reactions
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a dramatic showdown in a Western town, depicting a cowboy's triumphant action and eliciting immediate, diverse reactions from onlookers, ranging from admiration to condemnation.

narrative_arcs.title: Defense and Critique of Cowboy's Manners

Major_Arcs.title: Worry for Jeff, Gun Conflict, and Brotherly Intervention
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Sally's concern for her brother Jeff's behavior and fascination with guns, leading to a confrontation over gun handling and Jeff's admiration for a questionable figure, Clyde Surrett. It sets up a conflict between siblings and introduces external influences on Jeff's actions.

sub_scenes.title: Concern over Jeff's Hero Worship and Gun Fascination
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene establishes Sally's deep concern for Jeff's hero worship and unhealthy interest in guns, highlighting her worry about his development and potential negative influences.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Concern for Jeff's Hero Worship
Sally's Disappointment and Jeff's Clyde Surrett Defense
Jeff's Justification of Clyde Surrett and Dismissal of Chane Benson
Sally's Rejection of Jeff's Claims and Warning
Jeff's Threat and Sally's Fearful Response

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Plea for Help and Brotherly Commitment
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Sally seeking help to address Jeff's behavior, expressing her deep worry to Clyde Surrett and gaining Pete's commitment to intervene, highlighting the collaborative effort to guide Jeff.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Plea to Clyde and His Reassurance
Pete's Commitment to Helping Jeff and Sally's Appreciation
Pete's Flashback and Gun Advice to Young Jeff
Introduction of Mr. Benson and His Humble Response

Major_Arcs.title: Article Controversy, Benson's Resolve, and Town Tension
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers around the controversy sparked by Clyde Surrett's article, leading to public outrage and Sally's warnings to Mr. Benson. It shows Mr. Benson's determined response to stay and fight injustice using the newspaper, escalating town tensions.

sub_scenes.title: Public Outrage and Clyde's Defense
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the immediate public backlash against Clyde's article, showing a woman's angry confrontation and Clyde's defensive stance, highlighting the article's inflammatory impact.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Warning to Mr. Benson about Clyde's Anger
Mr. Benson's Dismissal of Danger and Confrontation with Sally
Mr. Benson's Justification for Staying in Town

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Confrontations and Clyde's Defiance
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene showcases the escalating conflict surrounding Clyde's article, with further confrontations, narrative exposition on Clyde's unwavering resolve, and Sally and Jeff's discussion about the situation, revealing different perspectives and mounting tension.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Defense Regarding Clyde's Article
Background on Clyde's Defiant Actions and Consequences
Sally and Jeff's Discussion about Clyde and Benson's Conflict

Major_Arcs.title: Dinner Invitation, Tension, and Violent Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts a dinner invitation extended to Chane, setting a deceptive tone. It then escalates to a heated confrontation between Jeff and Sally, leading to Jeff's violent actions and Benson's forceful intervention, dramatically increasing the stakes.

sub_scenes.title: Deceptive Dinner and Skill Assessment
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the dinner invitation to Chane and a subsequent discussion about Chane's gun skills, setting a seemingly social scene but hinting at underlying tensions and ulterior motives.

narrative_arcs.title: Dinner Invitation and Evaluation of Chane's Skills

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Jealousy and Physical Aggression
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts a heated and aggressive confrontation between Jeff and Sally, driven by Jeff's jealousy and misunderstanding of Sally's intentions, culminating in physical violence and emotional distress.

Major_Arcs.title: Pursuit, Reckoning, and Town Showdown
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows the immediate aftermath of Benson's assault, focusing on Sally's urgent need to reach town, Jeff's determined pursuit, and the explosive confrontation in town involving Benson and Jeff. It culminates in Benson's departure and a sense of uneasy resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Urgent Pursuit and Determined Ride
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Sally's urgent realization that Chane is pursuing Clyde and her desperate attempt to get Jeff to town to intervene, showing Jeff's determined and hazardous ride despite his injury.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Urgency and Chane's Pursuit of Clyde

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Benson's Departure
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the climactic confrontation in town, involving Benson's threats, Jeff's plea for non-violence, and Benson's eventual departure, bringing a tense resolution to the immediate conflict but leaving lingering tension and implications.

narrative_arcs.title: Anticipation and Fear at the Door

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Dynamics, New Boss, and Ranch Troubles
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a new setting - a ranch - and introduces new characters, including Steve Daley, the new boss. It establishes ranch dynamics, Betsy's competence as manager, and the emerging mystery of ranch troubles, including sabotage and missing cattle.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Brawl and New Boss Introduction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a ranch setting with an initial physical conflict and transitions to the arrival of Steve Daley as the new boss, setting up new power dynamics.

narrative_arcs.title: Ranch Brawl and Rejection of Gunplay
Introducing Steve Daley and the New Boss
Confirmation of Betsy's Competence and Steve's Approval

sub_scenes.title: Establishing Characters and Ranch Mystery
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on establishing the personalities of Steve and Betsy through their interaction, introducing Hank's skepticism about Steve, and revealing the serious ranch troubles that Betsy has been managing, creating a sense of mystery and impending conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Steve's Casual Acceptance and Betsy's Amusement
Hank's Skepticism and Betsy's Defense of Steve
Betsy's Accusation and Hank's Explanation of Ranch Troubles
Mutual Caution and Agreement to Investigate
Departure to Town and Buckboard Ride
Questioning Hank's Orders and Material for Dress

Major_Arcs.title: Town Arrival, Confrontation, and Gunslinger Revelation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Betsy and Steve's arrival in town, leading to a tense confrontation with Fred Bridges and his men. It culminates in a physical fight where Steve's gunslinger skills are revealed, and sets up a shift in their relationship dynamic.

sub_scenes.title: Town Arrival and Neighborly Tension
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Betsy and Steve's arrival in town and their initial interaction with a neighbor, setting a tone of familiarity mixed with underlying tension and social complexity.

sub_scenes.title: Verbal and Physical Confrontation with Bridges' Men
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene escalates the tension with a direct verbal confrontation between Betsy and Fred Bridges, quickly turning physical and showcasing Steve's swift and decisive fighting abilities, revealing his true nature as a gunslinger.

Major_Arcs.title: Gunslinger Proposition and Romantic Confession
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores the immediate aftermath of the town fight, focusing on Betsy and Steve's evolving relationship. It involves Betsy's assertion of ranch policy against gunmen, Steve's proposition to work as a gunslinger for her, and culminates in a romantic revelation and acceptance, setting up a romantic partnership.

sub_scenes.title: Departure Prep and Policy Assertion
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Betsy and Steve preparing to leave town, with Betsy asserting her ranch's policy against gunmen, seemingly in response to Steve's demonstrated skills in the fight.

sub_scenes.title: Gunslinger Proposition and Romantic Revelation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals Steve's true desire to work as a gunslinger for Betsy, leading to a romantic confession from him and mutual acknowledgment of feelings, culminating in a kiss and setting up a romantic partnership.

sub_scenes.title: Gun Policy Conflict and Romantic Compromise
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene highlights the conflict between Betsy's anti-gun stance and Steve's profession, leading to Betsy's condition that he give up his gun for her love, culminating in Steve's acceptance and a romantic resolution of this conflict.

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Troubles, Valley Route Danger, and Devil's Pass Ambush
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces new ranch-related conflicts, including Bridges' complaints and threats, Betsy's warning about the dangerous valley route, and a flashback to Steve's past betrayal and capture at Devil's Pass. It sets up a dangerous journey and foreshadows potential conflict related to Devil's Pass.

sub_scenes.title: Bridges' Complaint and Imminent Threat
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene establishes a new conflict with Old Man Bridges complaining about trespassers and his men issuing threats, setting up immediate danger and conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Valley Route Warning and Impending Confrontation

sub_scenes.title: Justification for Guns and Flashback to Betrayal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene delves into the thematic justification for carrying guns in the West and provides a crucial flashback to Steve's past betrayal and capture at Devil's Pass, explaining his cautiousness and setting up the significance of Devil's Pass.

Major_Arcs.title: Emotional Departure, Determined Revenge, and Pursuit
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the emotional parting of Betsy and Steve as he resolutely chooses a path of action, leading to his determined journey to Devil's Pass for confrontation. It culminates in Betsy's realization and decision to pursue him, setting up a dramatic confrontation at Devil's Pass.

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Confrontation and Resolute Departure
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene showcases the emotional parting between Betsy and Steve, with Betsy pleading against violence and Steve firmly choosing to pursue his course of action despite her wishes, emphasizing his determination and their diverging paths.

Major_Arcs.title: Devil's Pass Showdown, Intervention, and Romantic Reunion
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the climactic confrontation at Devil's Pass, with Steve facing his father's killer. It includes Betsy's dramatic intervention, her injury, and a subsequent emotional reunion and romantic resolution, bringing closure to their immediate conflict and reaffirming their love.

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Intervention at Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene sets the stage for the climax at Devil's Pass, showing Steve's arrival and confrontation with his father's killer, followed by Betsy's unexpected intervention and injury, escalating the tension to a critical point.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Confrontation

Major_Arcs.title: New Romantic Entanglement and Ranch Rivalry
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new romantic scenario with a rancher's daughter and two men, Dave and Fred, and simultaneously sets up a ranch rivalry plotline involving Bear Fenin's gang and land disputes, creating parallel storylines of romance and ranch conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Concern and Father's Disapproval
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a new romantic dilemma with the rancher's daughter expressing concern for Dave's feelings and her father's potential disapproval, setting up a love triangle and familial conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Dave and Father's Disapproval
Reflection on Morning Routine and Curley's Presence
Concern about Curley and Bear Fenin's Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Land Dispute and Fence Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a ranch rivalry plot with an older rancher's anger over a new fence impacting his grazing land, setting up a land dispute and potential conflict with Fred Gordon and his group.

narrative_arcs.title: Dispute Over Fencing and Grazing Land
Escalating Tension Over Fence and Water Access
Defensive Stance and Threat of Gunplay
Curley's Gun Draw and Impending Violence

Major_Arcs.title: Remorse, Love Triangle, and Reconciled Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores Curley's apology and remorse, delves into the love triangle between Carrie, Dave, and Fred, and culminates in Carrie and Fred's romantic reconciliation and engagement, resolving the romantic conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Curley's Apology and Confession of Guilt
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts focus to Curley's apology to Carrie, revealing his remorse for past actions and confessing his guilt and motivations related to Fred and Dave, providing backstory and character depth.

sub_scenes.title: Love Triangle Dynamics and Conflicted Feelings
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene delves into the complex love triangle between Carrie, Dave, and Fred, showing their conversation about feelings and Carrie's acknowledgment of her affection for both men, setting up the romantic conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie and Dave Discussing Feelings and Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Betrayal, Confrontation, and Emotional Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Carrie's discovery of Fred's manipulative intentions, leading to her assertive confrontation and rejection of him. It culminates in an emotional release and a sense of resolution, marking Carrie's empowerment and independence.

sub_scenes.title: Contract Deception and Carrie's Realization
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals Fred's manipulative intentions related to the Carlton Contract, leading to Carrie's realization of his deceit and setting up her subsequent confrontation.

sub_scenes.title: Public Confrontation and Emotional Catharsis
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Carrie's assertive public confrontation with Fred and Carlton, leading to her emotional breakdown and catharsis, and culminating in Fred's acknowledgment of her victory, bringing closure to the immediate conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Confrontation at Carlton's Office

Major_Arcs.title: Victory, Chance Encounter, and Lingering Feelings
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shows Carrie's reflection on her victory over Fred, a chance encounter with Dave, and her confession of love for Fred to Dave. It sets up a complex emotional landscape and unresolved romantic feelings amidst a backdrop of personal triumph.

sub_scenes.title: Reflection on Victory and Emotional Satisfaction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Carrie's internal reflection on her victory and her satisfaction in overcoming Fred's schemes, highlighting her sense of accomplishment and emotional triumph.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflecting on Fred's Defeat and Carrie's Victory
Chance Encounter and Casual Conversation at the Store
Inquiries About Fred and Confession of Love

Major_Arcs.title: Illness, Confrontation, and Reconciled Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Carrie's illness, a confrontation initiated by her father regarding Fred's actions, and a subsequent romantic reconciliation and proposal from Fred to Carrie, resolving their romantic conflict and moving towards marriage.

sub_scenes.title: Illness and Unexpected Visitors
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene establishes Carrie's unwell state and introduces the arrival of unexpected visitors, including Fred and Mr. Carlton, setting up a new confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Initial Concern and Arrival of Visitors

Major_Arcs.title: Brother's Injury, Pursuit, and Moral Dilemma
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new urgent situation with Dirk's injury and arrival, leading to a pursuit by the Marshal and a violent shootout. It culminates in a moral dilemma about mercy killing versus survival, dramatically escalating the tension.

sub_scenes.title: Urgent Arrival and Shocking Injury Revelation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a new character, Dirk, and an urgent situation with his arrival and the shocking revelation that he has been shot, setting up a crisis.

narrative_arcs.title: Escalating Confrontation and Claim of Authority
Passage of Time and Acceptance of Reality

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Confession and Escape Planning
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene combines romantic confession with strategic planning for Dirk's escape. It shows Chris and Rance's emotional exchange alongside Chris's growing resolve to help her brother escape, setting up a conflict between love and duty.

narrative_arcs.title: Re-emergence of Duty and Dirk's Fate

sub_scenes.title: Escape, Chase, and Violent Shootout
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the escape attempt, the immediate pursuit by the Marshal, a recount of their failed evasion tactics, and a violent shootout when confronted by the Marshal, escalating the action and danger.

narrative_arcs.title: Moral Dilemma: Mercy Killing vs. Survival

Major_Arcs.title: Aftermath, Confession, and Romantic Climax
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the aftermath of the shootout, showing Chris tending to Rance's injury, Rance's internal reflections and confession, Dirk's departure and noble sacrifice, and culminates in a romantic climax with Chris and Rance's reaffirmed love and engagement.

sub_scenes.title: First Aid, Reflection, and Brother's Departure
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the immediate aftermath, with Chris providing first aid, Rance reflecting on his feelings and Chris's actions, and Dirk making the selfless decision to leave, resolving the escape plotline and setting up the romantic resolution.

narrative_arcs.title: Providing First Aid and Assessing Injury
Parting Ways and Concern for Criminal Escape
Plea to Return and Confession of Love
Rance's Self-Recrimination and Awareness of Burden
Concern for Riding and Inquiry about Dirk
Successful Escape to Mexico and Relief

sub_scenes.title: Recovery, Reassurance, and Wedding Proposal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Rance's recovery, Chris's unwavering care and love, their mutual reassurance, and culminates in a marriage proposal and romantic resolution, bringing a happy ending to their personal journey.

narrative_arcs.title: Rance's Reassurance and Readiness for Action
